name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: Our mission is to educate and instil a drive for personal academic success, enrich through experience and expansion of what is really possible, and enlighten by means of taking the aforementioned experiences and incorporating them into their personal lives, households and communities.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).
zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: RELIGIOUS_CULTURAL (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document why reserves above your policy target are intentional (e.g., restrictions, volatility, planned commitments) and define deployment triggers.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Youth Foundation shows good impact and good alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

all_citations.claim: The organization holds 13.4 months of working capital and focuses on youth education.
Total revenue is $1,734,105 with a program expense ratio of 72.1%.
Programs include community services, youth sports, athletics, and mentoring.
The organization accepts charitable donations and sadaqah.
The foundation offers volunteer opportunities for community engagement.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate score of 59/100, reflecting efficient fundraising and solid working capital balanced against a lack of third-party verification and low data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data and external evaluations
Low data confidence due to limited public reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 30/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors interested in religious and cultural causes through sadaqah-eligible giving [4]. The organization provides pathways for community engagement through volunteer opportunities and athletic mentoring, though its track record is primarily documented through self-reported tax filings rather than independent assessments [3][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a program expense ratio of 72.1%, indicating that a majority of its $1,734,105 in total revenue is directed toward its core mission of youth education and community services [2]. While the organization maintains a healthy 13.4 months of working capital, the impact score of 30/50 reflects a focus on capacity building with limited external data available to verify specific long-term outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Youth Foundation provides a dedicated facility for youth education, enrichment, and athletic mentoring.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong liquidity position with 13.4 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) operates as a community-focused organization dedicated to creating a facility for youth enlightenment and enrichment [1][2]. The foundation manages diverse programming including community services, youth sports, and athletics mentoring to support local development [3].
